Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of an Augmented Reality-Based Portable Navigation System for Acetabular Cup Placement in Total Hip Arthroplasty

Trial_Design.evidence: 46 patients undergoing THA were randomly assigned

Intervention.evidence: AR navigation group or the conventional group

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the accuracy of acetabular component placement using an augmented reality (AR)-based portable navigation system compared to the conventional freehand technique during total hip arthroplasty (THA).

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the absolute difference between the targeted and postoperative measured placement angles

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using a computer-generated sequence, and allocation was concealed.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 46 patients undergoing THA were randomly assigned

Result_Outcome.evidence: The AR navigation group showed smaller mean differences in radiographic inclination compared to the conventional group (2.3° ± 1.4° vs. 3.9° ± 2.4°; p = 0.009) and in CT images (1.9° ± 1.3° vs. 3.4° ± 2.6°; p = 0.02).

Harms.evidence: No complications were reported with the AR system.
